title.value: Advanced MRI metrics improve the prediction of baseline disease severity for individuals with degenerative cervical myelopathy
title.justification: The title is directly mentioned in the provided paper summary.
title.quote: Advanced MRI metrics improve the prediction of baseline disease severity for individuals with degenerative cervical myelopathy

extractions.description: The paper investigates the predictive ability of advanced MRI metrics in assessing the baseline severity of degenerative cervical myelopathy (DCM) compared to standard MRI metrics. It utilizes machine learning models to analyze MRI data from patients with DCM to improve the prediction accuracy of disease severity.

type.justification: The study involves actual analysis of imaging data from patients using machine learning models to predict disease severity, indicating empirical research.
type.quote: METHODS: Patients enrolled in the Canadian Spine Outcomes Research Network registry with DCM were screened and 296 cervical spine MRIs acquired in cMRI were compared with 228 aMRI acquisitions.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on MRI scans and the analysis of these images using machine learning to predict disease severity.
name.quote: PURPOSE: This study examines the predictive ability of current MRI sequences relative to 'advanced MRI' (aMRI) metrics designed to detect evidence of spinal cord injury secondary to degenerative mye-lopathy.

name.justification: Machine learning models are utilized in the study to predict disease severity based on MRI data.
name.quote: Through the utilization of Random Forest Classifiers, disease severity was predicted with 41.8% accuracy in cMRI scans and 73.3% in the aMRI scans.

name.justification: The study is applied within the healthcare domain to improve clinical outcomes for patients with degenerative cervical myelopathy.
name.quote: This work serves to demonstrate the potential of imaging sequences beyond T2-weighted scans in predicting DCM disease severity. MRI scans have often been considered unreliable in determining DCM disease severity.

name.justification: The Random Forest Classifier is explicitly mentioned as the model used for prediction in the study.
name.quote: Through the utilization of Random Forest Classifiers, disease severity was predicted with 41.8% accuracy in cMRI scans and 73.3% in the aMRI scans.

is_contributed.justification: The Random Forest Classifier is a well-known machine learning algorithm and is not novel in the scope of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Random Forest Classifiers were selected over Logistic Regression, Gradient Boosting Classifier, and Support Vector Classification models based on their performance in preliminary tests.

is_executed.justification: The model's prediction accuracy is discussed in the context of the study.
is_executed.quote: The Random Forest Classifier model alone performed the best with an accuracy of 73.3%.

is_compared.justification: Random Forest Classifier is compared with other models like Logistic Regression and Support Vector Classification.
is_compared.quote: Random Forest Classifiers were selected over Logistic Regression, Gradient Boosting Classifier, and Support Vector Classification models based on their performance in preliminary tests.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Scikit-learn is mentioned as the library used, which is associated with machine learning model implementations including Random Forest.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The versions of the tools used for these methods were as follows: scikit-learn v.0.23.2.

name.justification: The cMRI dataset is mentioned, describing standard MRI data used for comparison.
name.quote: The cMRI group consisted of only T 2 -weighted MRI scans.

referenced_paper_title.value: A full breakdown of the various testing protocols for the community MRI dataset used in this study can be found in our research center’s previously published work.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced work likely contains detailed information on the dataset used in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A full breakdown of the various testing protocols for the community MRI dataset used in this study can be found in our research center’s previously published work [17].

name.justification: The aMRI dataset is discussed as containing advanced imaging sequences.
name.quote: aMRI acquisitions consisted of diffusion tensor imaging, magnetization transfer, T 2 -weighted, and T 2 *-weighted images.

referenced_paper_title.quote: The rationale for the aMRI protocol can be found in the spine generic acquisition protocol paper [16].
